levels.title: Airlock Malfunction
levels.story: Warning! Space Station Omega has experienced a critical systems failure. You are trapped in the outer research module with life support failing. To override the airlock, you must answer the security question: 'I'm found in the depths of space, but also in your home. I can be hot or cold. I'm always around, but you can never touch me. What am I?'
levels.hint: You breathe it every day, but it's also in the vacuum of space...

levels.title: Navigation Systems
levels.story: The airlock opens, but the station's navigation systems are offline. You need to reboot the main computer to send a distress signal. The terminal flashes: 'Security verification required. Answer: I run but never walk. I have a mouth but never talk. I have a head but never weep. I have a bed but never sleep. What am I?'

levels.title: Command Center
levels.story: You've reached the command center! To transmit the distress signal, you need to input the final override code. The captain's last log entry reads: 'In case of emergency, remember: It can be cracked, it can be made, it can be told, and it can be played. What is it?'

success.title: Rescue Inbound!
success.message: Distress signal successfully transmitted! Sensors detect a rescue ship approaching. Estimated arrival: 10 minutes. Congratulations on your quick thinking and problem-solving skills, Officer. You've saved yourself and preserved valuable research data.
